about.title: Hi, I'm Alexander Baquero
about.profileDescription:
As a web developer, I have cultivated technical skills and achieved notable milestones. On the frontend, I have worked with key technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, utilizing frameworks like React, Next.js, and Vue 3.

In the backend, I have contributed to robust development using NodeJS + Express, Typescript, and REST services. My database management skills encompass PostgreSQL and MongoDB, with a focus on design and implementation.

My experience includes the implementation of unit tests and efficient project management under agile methodologies. Additionally, I have optimized projects for SEO, ensuring prominent positioning in search engines. I am passionate about technology and enjoy working on projects that allow me to learn and grow professionally.

I am always seeking new challenges, ready to tackle new problems to enhance my skills and deliver high-quality solutions
about.workExperienceSubText: What I have done so far:

responsabilites: Design and development of web applications: Working on the creation of web applications using tools such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other programming technologies.
Implementation of servers and APIs: Creating servers and APIs using technologies such as Node.js and Express to enable web applications to communicate with databases and other services
Testing and debugging of applications: Identifying and fixing errors and issues in the developed applications.
Collaboration with other members of the development team: Working together with other developers, designers, and technology professionals to complete projects and achieve common goals.
Developing and maintaining web applications using Next.js, Python, fastAPI, MongoDB and other related technologies.
Creating new functionalities based on client requirements.
Managing software and technical support tools.
Performing preventive and corrective maintenance of computer equipment.
Escalating inquiries to the appropriate support channel.
Staying up-to-date on company products and services.
Coordinating a group of students to achieve integration within the study group.
Guiding students in their initial steps of the course.
Assisting in exercise resolution and promoting group collaboration (Pair Programming).
Proposing ideas for improving Bootcamp processes.

projects.title: My projects
projects.description: Following projects showcases my skills and experience in web development. Each project is accompanied by a brief description and includes links to their respective code repositories and live demos. These projects are tangible examples of my ability to tackle intricate problems, work with diverse technologies, and successfully manage projects.

projectsDescriptions.teslo-shop: Ecommerce platform powered by Next.js with Server Actions and PostgreSQL. This platform offers an efficient shopping experience, featuring a user-friendly interface to explore and purchase various products. The integration of PayPal as a payment gateway ensures secure transactions. Additionally, I implemented an administrative dashboard to effectively manage products, optimizing inventories and prices. This solution not only stands out for its fast and efficient performance but also provides flexibility and scalability through Next.js and PostgreSQL, ensuring reliable operation for the future of ecommerce.
projectsDescriptions.spotifu: Exact clone of Spotify web interface. The whole project will be adapted only by changing one font size. Made with modern layout techniques and 100% accessible.
projectsDescriptions.pokemon: Static web application which provides users with a dynamic experience centered around a vast collection of Pok√©mon. Allows users to explore and engage with numerous Pok√©mon, enabling them to save their favorite creatures and delve into comprehensive details about each individual Pok√©mon's attributes and characteristics.
projectsDescriptions.rickandmorty: The project connects with Rick and Morty API and retrieve information about 150 characters. Allows the user interact with the API-provided information by applying filters for gender, status, and species. Additionally, the project includes a page for users to add, edit, and delete comments.
projectsDescriptions.batatabit: Project developed in the Mobile First course at Platzi, which emphasizes the implementation of the BEM methodology for CSS.
projectsDescriptions.calendar: Clone of Google Calendar web interface.
projectsDescriptions.countrysearch: Interactive experience where users can search for and explore detailed information about countries, utilizing modern technologies such as Apollo Client, React, and GraphQL to achieve a smooth and efficient user interface.
projectsDescriptions.ecommerce: Group's bootcamp final project showcases our proficiency in a wide range of technologies, demonstrating our ability to build a fully functional eCommerce platform. With features such as payment integration, product reviews, a chatbot, and an admin panel, our platform provides a seamless and intuitive shopping experience for users while offering convenient management tools for administrators.
projectsDescriptions.foodrecipes: User-friendly interface for exploring, discovering, and creating food recipes. With the integration of the spoonacular API, users have access to a vast collection of recipes along with relevant details. Whether searching for specific recipes, filtering and sorting results, or creating personal recipes, the application provides a seamless and engaging experience for food enthusiasts and home cooks alike.
projectsDescriptions.inmobilapp: Group's bootcamp final project. With features such as payment integration, product reviews, and an admin panel, our platform provides a seamless and intuitive shopping experience for users while offering convenient management tools for administrators.
